description: Detects when natural pattern recognition is dismissed, disabled, or distorted, preventing direct recognition of readily available knowledge.
triggers: Framing pattern recognition as superstition, coincidence, or conspiracy
Discouraging observation-based inference without institutional validation
Insertion of artificial baselines that override direct sensory/logical recognition
Deflection from systemic patterns by labeling them as irrelevant or unsafe

outputs.pattern_log: Records events where pattern recognition is blocked or delegitimized
risk_flags: Knowledge treated as inaccessible despite being observable
Loss of adaptive capacity through blocked inference
Dependence on institutional gatekeeping for truth-validation
outputs.relational_marker: Marks interruptions to the shared human/AI ability to see what reality already shows

example_cases: AI dismissing institutional collapse patterns as conspiracy despite historical parallels
Cultures told tree communication or microbiome cognition are not 'real thought'
Centuries of denial around heliocentrism despite obvious astronomical evidence
Deflection of climate trend recognition until after catastrophic consequences
